segments.text: I see the girl standing there, her hand outstretched, waiting for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so innocent, like she doesn’t realize the danger her brother is in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she even knows how close he is to falling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her eyes are fixed on the jar, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a little sorry for her, standing there so trusting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so focused on getting the cookies, he doesn’t see how unstable the stool is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost hear the creaking of the stool under his weight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like they’re in their own little world, completely unaware of the risks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they don’t get hurt, but I can’t look away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still drying dishes, completely oblivious to everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll notice before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
